qas.question: Who came up with the name Nigeria in the 19th century?
What was Nigeria's region called by the British before the name Nigeria?
What language does the name of the Niger River come from?

context: The name Nigeria was taken from <a0_0>the Niger River<a0_0/> running through the country. This name was allegedly coined in the late 19th century by British journalist <a1_0>Flora Shaw<a1_0/>, she was inspired by the name of the river, in preference to terms such as "<a2_0>Central Sudan<a2_0/>". The origin of the name ''Nigeria'' came from the name of the <a4_0>Niger<a4_0/> River. The word ( Niger )  is an alteration of the <a3_0>Tuareg<a3_0/> name egerew n-igerewen used by inhabitants along the middle reaches of the river around Timbuktu prior to 19th-century European colonialism. Egerew n-igerewen means River of the Rivers.
